Comments_List: You learn not only the language but the beautiful French culture as well. The language skills could have an overflow effect on your English writing skills
I picked up a lot of grammatical rules in French of which there are so many. My fluency developed a bit as well
Basic skills in speaking, writing, and listening in French, as well as some linguistic and cultural background that helps me to enjoy the French language itself.
French skills. I remembered how hard it is learning another language.

weaknesses:
Inconsistency of lectureship 
lack of usage of reading textbook

Strengths
Very interactive, immersion method of teaching and learning
You pick up the language fast

Weaknesses
Huge workload but the materials are exciting so you do not see time go by
This course gives the student a lot of practice with the material.

Strength: the intensity of class: since I have class every morning and exams every weak, I was never allowed to be separated from French. Thanks to this, I could improve my skills in French at an unbelievable speed.
The class went a little fast, but that's expected given language classes at Yale. Having profs speak only in French is great with the whole immersion thing.
I definitely recommend it as you not only learn a language but you engage with a beautiful culture. The instructors are full of energy and exciting
Uses the Capretz method and it works!
Yes. The class is intensive and usually demanding (class/homework everyday and exam/composition every week), but it surely deserve your efforts.
Yes. The course allows students to learn a lot in a short period. It is well structured, and the instructors are more than happy to help the students with whatever they need in order to improve.
